register.description: ECD5 PID

Raw status of sources for interrupt INT0. Raw status is set even if the interrupt is not enabled; Write 1 to set the raw status (mostly for debug)
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Set event (for debug) Read 0: No event pending Read 1: Event pending

bitfield.description: End of Row Status.
DMA of first page of bitstream fetch from DDR to SL2 completed in decode status. This bit is valid only in CAVLC decode.
Unit processing startcode search done. This bit is valid only in CAVLC decode.
Slice init done status
End of Frame Status.
Bitstream DMA termination completed status. This bit is valid only in CAVLC decode.
End of Macroblock Status.
End of N Macroblock (i.e. counter 1 expired) Status.
End of Pipe Status.
Auto Load Done Status.
End of Slice Status.
End of N Macroblock (i.e. counter 0 expired) Status.

register.description:
Raw status of sources for interrupt INT_ERR0 Raw status is set even if the interrupt is not enabled; Write 1 to set the raw status (mostly for debug)
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Set event (for debug) Read 0: No event pending Read 1: Event pending

bitfield.description: End of slice overrun error. This bit is valid only in CAVLC decode. This error status bit is set, if during MB decoding, bit pointer overruns the position of end of slice. Byte stream format : If the bit pointer overruns the start code of the next slice, this status bit is set. NALU or fragmented NALU format : If the bit counter reaches the programmed size (BITSTRMx_CTRL.SBC_NALU_CFG.SIZE) of NALU and slice data decode is not completed, this status bit is set

Underflow in bitstream during startcode search after EOS error. This bit is valid only in CAVLC decode. This error status bit is set when the ECD5 does not detect startcode even after decoding all the bitstream data provided, while doing a startcode search after EOS.
CAVLC Decoder Error. This bit is valid only in CAVLC decode. Tthe exact source of error is reflected in BE_STAT.CAVLC_ERR_STATUS

Temporal B Direct Detected Error. This bit is valid only in CAVLC decode. This error status bit is set if Temporal B Direct decode is disabled (by setting BE_FUNC.CAVLC_CFG.TEMPORAL_B_DIRECT_ERROR_ENABLE to 1) and a Temporal B Direct MB is detected in the decoded (CAVLC) bit stream

End of frame is not end of slice error. This bit is valid only in CAVLC decode. This error status bit is set if the corresponding error enable bit (BE_FUNC.CAVLC_CFG.EOF_NOT_EOS_ERROR_ENABLE) is set and the following condition is true : - End of slice is not detected in the CAVLC bitstream, but all MBs in the picture have been decoded.

Bitstream descriptors were not programmed when bit stream DMA was initialized, error. This bit is valid only in CAVLC decode. This error status bit is set when bit-stream DMA is triggered (internally by the HW, or externally through SW programmation) but the bit-stream descriptors have not been programmed before this happens.

During decode, underflow in bitstream during MB decode error. This bit is valid only in CAVLC decode or encode. This error status bit is set when the ECD5 reached the end of the provided bitstream during macroblock decode. During encode, overflow in bitstream during MB encode error. This error status bit is set when the ECD5 reached the end of the provided DDR buffer during macroblock encode.

BE error due to error detected in FE. This bit is valid only in CABAC decode , in both frame decoupled and non-frame-decoupled modes. This error status bit is set when the ECD5 detects an error in the BE, due to an error indication from the FE. The error indication from the FE is obtained as follows : - in frame decoupled mode, when the BE reaches an MB programmed as an error MB in BE_ERROR_MB_CFG - in non-frame decoupled mode, when the BE reaches an MB indicated as an error MB through internal signalling from the BE
BE Decoder Error. Tthe exact source of error is reflected in BE_STATUS.BE_CORE_ERR_STATUS

Underflow in bitstream during startcode search unit processing This bit is valid only in CAVLC decode. This error status bit is set when the ECD5 does not detect startcode even after decoding all the bitstream data provided, while doing startcode search unit processing.

register.description:
Raw status of sources for interrupt INT_STRM0 Raw status is set even if the interrupt is not enabled; Write 1 to set the raw status (mostly for debug)
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Set event (for debug) Read 0: No event pending Read 1: Event pending

bitfield.description: Status bit indicating completion of - in decode, DMA of 1 page of bitstream fetch from DDR to SL2 - in encode, DMA of 1 page of bitstream write from SL2 to DDR

DDR or SL2 bitstream data descriptor loaded status.
In regular mode of bitstream DRM operation, this bit is set when contents of DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES in the BITSTRM0_CTRL register set are copied into the corresponding shadow register, when the DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES_SHADOW register contents transition to 0 Note that this bit is not set when the shadow registers are updated for the first time (i.e. when DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES is written for the first time (and the corresponding shadow register is empty)
In DMSP mode of bitstream DRM operation, this bit is set when contents of SL2_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES in the BITSTRM0_CTRL register set are copied into the corresponding shadow register, when the SL2_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES_SHADOW register contents transition to 0 Note that this bit is not set when the shadow registers are updated for the first time (i.e. when SL2_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES is written for the first time (and the corresponding shadow register is empty)

DDR or SL2 bitstream data descriptor underflow status.
In regular mode of bitstream DRM operation, this bit is set when contents of DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES_SHADOW in the BITSTRM0_CTRL register set transitions to 0, and the corresponding non-shadow register - DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES - has not yet been programmed with new value.
In DMSP mode of bitstream DRM operation, this bit is set when contents of SL2_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES_SHADOW in the BITSTRM0_CTRL register set transitions to 0, and the corresponding non-shadow register - SL2_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES - has not yet been programmed with new value.
DMA request status. This bit is valid only in SW interactive mode of bitstream DMA - if "1" indicates that a request for DMA of 1 page of bitstream data is pending

register.description:
Raw status of sources for interrupt INT1; Raw status is set even if the interrupt is not enabled; Write 1 to set the raw status (mostly for debug)
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Set event (for debug) Read 0: No event pending Read 1: Event pending

DMA of first page of bitstream fetch from DDR to SL2 completed in decode status. This bit is valid only in CABAC decode.
Unit processing startcode search done. This bit is valid only in CABAC decode.
Slice init done status
End of Frame Status
Bitstream DMA termination completed status. This bit is valid only in CABAC decode.
End of Macroblock Status
End of N Macroblock (i.e. counter 1 expired) Status.
End of Pipe Status
Auto Load Done Status
End of Slice Status
End of N Macroblock (i.e. counter 0 expired) Status.

register.description:
Raw status of sources for interrupt INT_ERR1 Raw status is set even if the interrupt is not enabled; Write 1 to set the raw status (mostly for debug)
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Set event (for debug) Read 0: No event pending Read 1: Event pending

bitfield.description: End of slice mismatch error. This bit is valid only in CABAC decode. This error status bit is set if the corresponding error enable bit (FE_FUNC.CABAC_CFG.EOS_MISMATCH_ERROR_ENABLE) is set and one of the following conditions is true : * There is no more data in the CABAC bitstream (more_rbsp_data() is false), but end of slice is not detected in the bitstream * End of slice is detected in the CABAC bitstream, but there is still more data to be decoded in the slice (more_rbsp_data() is true)

End of slice overrun error. This bit is valid only in CABAC decode. This error status bit is set, if during MB decoding, bit pointer overruns the position of end of slice. Byte stream format : If the bit pointer overruns the start code of the next slice, this status bit is set. NALU or fragmented NALU format : If the bit counter reaches the programmed size (BITSTRMx_CTRL.SBC_NALU_CFG.SIZE) of NALU and slice data decode is not completed, this status bit is set

Underflow in bitstream during startcode search after EOS error. This bit is valid only in CABAC decode. This error status bit is set when the ECD5 does not detect startcode even after decoding all the bitstream data provided, while doing a startcode search after EOS.
CABAC Decoder Error; the exact source of error is reflected in FE_STATUS.CABAC_ERR_STATUS

Temporal B Direct Detected Error. This error status bit is set if Temporal B Direct decode is disabled (by setting FE_FUNC.CABAC_CFG.TEMPORAL_B_DIRECT_ERROR_ENABLE to 1) and a Temporal B Direct MB is detected in the decoded (CABAC) bit stream

End of frame is not end of slice error. This bit is valid only in CABAC decode. This error status bit is set if the corresponding error enable bit (FE_FUNC.CABAC_CFG.EOF_NOT_EOS_ERROR_ENABLE) is set and if the following conditions is true : - End of slice is not detected in the CABAC bitstream, but all MBs in the picture have been decoded.

Bitstream descriptors were not programmed when bit stream DMA was initialized, error. This bit is valid only in CABAC decode. This error status bit is set when bit-stream DMA is triggered (internally by the HW, or externally through SW programmation) but the bit-stream descriptors have not been programmed before this happens.

During decode, underflow in bitstream during MB decode error. This bit is valid only in CABAC decode. This error status bit is set when the ECD5 reached the end of the provided bitstream during macroblock decode.

FE error due to error detected in BE. This bit is valid only in CABAC decode in non-frame decoupled mode, or in CAVLC decode. This error status bit is set when the ECD5 detects an error in the FE, due to an error indication from the BE through internal signalling.

Underflow in bitstream during startcode search unit processing This error status bit is set when the ECD5 does not detect startcode even after decoding all the bitstream data provided, while doing startcode search unit processing.

DDR or SL2 bitstream data descriptor loaded status.
In regular mode of bitstream DRM operation, this bit is set when contents of DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES in the BITSTRM1_CTRL register set are copied into the corresponding shadow register, when the DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES_SHADOW register contents transition to 0 Note that this bit is not set when the shadow registers are updated for the first time (i.e. when DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES is written for the first time (and the corresponding shadow register is empty)

DDR or SL2 bitstream data descriptor underflow status.
In regular mode of bitstream DRM operation, this bit is set when contents of DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES_SHADOW in the BITSTRM1_CTRL register set transitions to 0, and the corresponding non-shadow register - DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES - has not yet been programmed with new value.
In DMSP mode of bitstream DRM operation, this bit is set when contents of SL2_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES_SHADOW in the BITSTRM1_CTRL register set transitions to 0, and the corresponding non-shadow register - SL2_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES - has not yet been programmed with new value.
DMA request status. This bit is valid only in SW interactive mode of bitstream DMA - if "1" indicates that a request for DMA of 1 page of bitstream data is pending

register.description:
Status of enabled sources for interrupt INT0. The individual status bits are not set, unless the source is enabled (by setting corresponding bit in IRQ_ENABLE_SET register) Write "1" to specific bit in this register to clear the status after interrupt has been serviced. Note : Writing "1" clears the "raw" status as well Note : Writing "1" generates internal EOI. The interrupt line is pulsed again, if any of the interrupt sources are still active (any of the status bits are "1") after the write of "1".
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Clear (raw) event - clears the corresponding bit in this register as well as the "raw" status bit in the IRQ_STATUS_RAW register Read 0: No enabled event pending Read 1: Event pending

register.description:
Interrupt enable for each of the sources for interrupt INT0 Writing "1" to specific field in this register enables the corresponding source for interrupt generatation The read value reflects whether the corresponding source is enabled/disabled for interrupt generation
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Enable interrupt Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked) Read 1: Interrupt enabled

The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Enable interrupt Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked) Read 1: Interrupt enabled

register.description:
Interrupt blocking configuration for interrupt INT0
If a bit in this register is set to "1", the ECD5 halts after it generates an interrupt for the corresponding interrupt source, and waits for interrupt acknowledgement for that interrupt line before continuing execution.
If a bit in this register is set to "0", the ECD5 does not halt after it generates an interrupt for the corresponding interrupt source
The configuration in this register only apply to enabled interrupt sources
Note : The halt on blocking interrupt is independent for FE and BE; i.e. if BE generates a blocking interrupt, only the BE is halted until ack is received; the FE continues processing.

register.description: ECD5 Common configuration - common for FE and BE

bitfield.description: Specifies if frame level decoupling is enabled for CABAC 0 - No frame level decoupling 1 - Frame level decoupling enabled

register.description:
ECD5 Channel switching control
This register controls the channel switching behaviour of ECD5. This register is used for both FE and BE switching. This register is used only in decode mode (since in encode, the ECD5 is not the head of the pipe) Note : Channel switching has to be disabled in frame decoupling mode (ECD5_COMMON_CFG.CABAC_FRAME_DECOUPLING_EN = 1), since channel switching is not specified in this mode

bitfield.description: Specifies the Y position in the frame, of the MB, after which, switching happens , i.e. end of pipe will be asserted on reaching end of slice
Specifies the X position in the frame, of the MB, after which, switching happens , i.e. end of pipe will be asserted on reaching end of slice
Specifies if channel switching is enabled 0 - Disabled; 1 - Enabled

register.description: ECD5 Control for direct bitstream communication interface with iCont

bitfield.description: Specifies if direct bitstream communication interface with iCont is enabled 0 - Disable interface 1 - Enable interface

register.description: ECD5 Bin SBC configuration

bitfield.description: If 1, enables the bypass mode for all the bin SBCs in word mode; debug only

register.description: FE Enable

bitfield.description: Setting this bit enables the FE Engine. This bit is cleared on end of frame/sub-frame.

register.description: FE Unit Enable

bitfield.description: Specifies the function to trigger in unit processing mode (MODE == 0). Irrelevant in frame mode (MODE == 1) 0x00 - Slice Data Processing 0x01 - Startcode Search 0x02 - Bitstream DMA Initialization 0x03 - Bitstream DMA termination 0x04 - End of Pipe Processing Other values are unsupported

Setting this bit triggers the selected engine/flow. For slice data processing, this bit needs to be set to trigger the slice data processing flow, after the slice header decoding is complete. This bit is cleared on completion of the selected engine/flow processing. Writing '0' is ignored. Setting to '1' while already set is also ignored. The bit should be set only when it is '0', i.e. no processing function is currently active

register.description: FE MB Enable

bitfield.description: Triggers the FE MB processing engine, when MB level control is enabled (FUNC_MMR.FE_L1_CFG_0.SDP_MB_MODE == 1 ) This bit is cleared on completion of MB processing

register.description: Enable and SL2 location of the Auto Load MMR Image

bitfield.description: Program Auto Load SL2 Base Address; the last 4 bits are ignored and are assumed 0
1 => Program Auto Load Enabled

register.description: Enable and SL2 location of the Context MMR Image Note : Currently unused; reserved for future use.

bitfield.description: 1 => Context Auto Load Enabled
Context Auto Load / Store SL2 Base Address
1 => Context Auto Store Enabled

register.description: Control for FE N-MB Interrupt 0

bitfield.description: Number of MBs, after which FE N-MB interrupt 0 needs to be generated. If 1, interrupt generated every MB. MAX_COUNT of 0 is illegal; EN bit should be 0 if MAX_COUNT = 0.
Enable/disable counter to generate FE N-MB interrupt 0

register.description: Count of number of MBs completed, for controlling FE N-MB interrupt 0

bitfield.description: If FE_MB_COUNT_CTRL_0.EN == 1, this field is incremented, and then compared against FE_MB_COUNT_CTRL_0.MAX_COUNT, for each MB executed. If compare matches (and FE_MB_COUNT_CTRL_0.EN == 1 ), FE N-MB interrupt 0 is generated (if the interrupt is enabled), and the field is reset to 0.

register.description: Control for FE N-MB Interrupt 1

bitfield.description: Number of MBs, after which FE N-MB interrupt 1 needs to be generated. If 1, interrupt generated every MB. MAX_COUNT of 0 is illegal; EN bit should be 0 if MAX_COUNT = 0.
Enable/disable counter to generate FE N-MB interrupt 1

register.description: Count of number of MBs completed, for controlling FE N-MB interrupt 1

bitfield.description: If FE_MB_COUNT_CTRL_1.EN == 1, this field is incremented, and then compared against FE_MB_COUNT_CTRL_1.MAX_COUNT, for each MB executed. If compare matches ( and FE_MB_COUNT_CTRL_1.EN == 1 ), FE N-MB interrupt 1 is generated (if the interrupt is enabled), and the field is reset to 0.

register.description: BE Enable

bitfield.description: Setting this bit enables the BE Engine. This bit is cleared on end of frame/sub-frame.

register.description: BE Unit Enable This register is valid only in encode and CAVLC decode. It is unused in CABAC decode.

bitfield.description: Specifies the function to trigger for encode and CAVLC decode. 0x00 - Slice Data Processing 0x01 - Startcode Search 0x02 - Bitstream DMA initialization 0x03 - Bitstream DMA termination 0x04 - End of Pipe Processing Other values are unsupported

Setting this bit triggers the selected engine/flow. For slice data processing, this bit needs to be set to trigger the slice data processing flow, after the slice header decoding is complete. This bit is cleared on completion of the selected engine/flow processing. Writing '0' is ignored. Setting to '1' while already set is also ignored. The bit should be set only when it is '0', i.e. no processing function is currently active

register.description: BE MB Enable

bitfield.description: Triggers the BE MB processing engine, when MB level control is enabled (FUNC_MMR.BE_L1_CFG_0.SDP_MB_MODE == 1 ) This bit is cleared on completion of MB processing

register.description: BE Entropy Coding mode

bitfield.description: 1 => The entropy mode setting is valid 0 => The entropy coding mode is not valid The ECD5 BE logic waits until this bit is set, before it starts the actual processing of data.
Specifies the entropy coding scheme for the BE logic 0 - CAVLC 1 - CABAC

register.description: Enable and SL2 location of the Auto Load MMR Image

bitfield.description: Program Auto Load SL2 Base Address
1 => Program Auto Load Enabled

register.description: Enable and SL2 location of the Context MMR Image Note : Currently unused; reserved for future use.

bitfield.description: 1 => Context Auto Load Enabled
Context Auto Load / Store SL2 Base Address
1 => Context Auto Store Enabled

register.description: ECD5 BE Error MB configuration This register is to be written by SW only in frame decoupled mode for CABAC decode in the BE. This register specifies if an erroneous MB was decoded in the FE in the current frame (when it was decoded earlier in the FE), and if so the address of the next MB that has the error. In non-frame decoupled mode and in CABAC decode, this register is set by the FE H/W to indicate to the BE if an error was detected by the FE, and the MB in which the error was detected.

bitfield.description: Specifies the Y position of the next MB that is erroneous (detected to be in error by the FE) in the current frame
Specifies the X position of the next MB that is erroneous (detected to be in error by the FE) in the current frame

Specifies if an erroneous MB is present in the current frame, in the future, from the current point of decoding. If there is no other MB that is erroneous in the current frame, this bit will have to be reset, before re-enabling the BE after the previous error. This bit should be written by SW only in the frame decoupled configuration, and when the BE is triggered for CABAC decoding. In non-frame decoupled mode CABAC decode, this bit will be set by the H/W if an error is detected by the FE.

register.description: Control forBFE N-MB Interrupt 0

bitfield.description: Number of MBs, after which BE N-MB interrupt 0 needs to be generated. If 1, interrupt generated every MB. MAX_COUNT of 0 is illegal; EN bit should be 0 if MAX_COUNT = 0.
Enable/disable counter to generate BE N-MB interrupt 0

bitfield.description: If BE_MB_COUNT_CTRL_0.EN == 1, this field is incremented, and then compared against BE_MB_COUNT_CTRL_0.MAX_COUNT, for each MB executed. register.description: Enable for dependency on spare BCs

bitfield.description: 1 - Enable dependency on spare producer SL2BC
1 - Enable dependency on spare consumer SL2BC

register.description: BC Clear Register for FE in frame decoupled mode Setting a bit initializes the corresponding BC (if buffer controller present) and/or the corresponding BC write interface (if present) The bits are auto-cleared

bitfield.description: BC Clear for sliceInfo BC; Setting this bit to "1" - Initializes the input sliceInfo BC

register.description: BC Clear Register Setting a bit initializes the corresponding BC (if buffer controller present) and/or the corresponding BC write interface (if present) The bits are auto-cleared

bitfield.description: BC Clear for Top_Neighb_MVData BC; Setting this bit to "1" - Initializes the output Top_Neighb_MVData BC interface
BC Clear for sliceInfo BC; Setting this bit to "1" - Initializes the input sliceInfo BC - Initializes the output sliceInfo BC interface - Initializes the internal sliceInfo BC between FE and BE
BC Clear for iCONT BC# 0; Setting this bit to "1" - Initializes the input spare BC #0
BC Clear for iCONT BC#; Setting this bit to "1" - Initializes the input spare BC #1
BC Clear for Residual BC; Setting this bit to "1" - Initializes the input residual BC - Initializes the output residual BC interface

BC Clear for MBInfo BC; Setting this bit to "1" - Initializes the input MBInfo BC - Initializes the output MBInfo top BC interface - Initializes the output MBInfo bottom BC interface - Initializes the internal MB level BC between FE and BE
BC Clear for refLayer ECd MBInfo BC; Setting this bit to "1" - Initializes the input interLayerInfo BC
BC Clear for NearNeighbourFlag BC; Setting this bit to "1" - Initializes the output NF1 BC interface

register.description: FE Bin stream 0 SBC Control

bitfield.description: Writing "1" resets SBC; for debug only
Writing "1" opens SBC for reading; automatically cleared on open completion
Writing "1" opens SBC for writing; automatically cleared on open completion
Writing "1" resets the bit counters in SBC; resets SBC_TOTAL_COUNT to 0; also resets internal counters; cleared in the next cycle.
Writing "1" closes SBC; automatically cleared on close completion

register.description: FE Bin stream 0 SBC Status

bitfield.description: If 1, indicates that an overflow error is seen; cleared on open completion.
If 1, indicates that codec i/f of SBC is stalled (not ready), due to lack of data in the internal registers of the SBC; valid after open; cleared on codec i/f becoming unstalled.
If 1, indicates that SBC is active - can be in read/write or halted state; valid after open; cleared on close
If 1, indicates that the SL2 i/f of SBC is halted, due to lack of bitstream data in the SL2; valid after open; cleared when SL2 i/f is unhalted

register.description: FE Bin stream 0 SBC SL2 pointer
FE Bin stream 0 Number of bins written by the codec

bitfield.description: Total bits written by the codec; this register can be written w/ initial value before the SBC is opened

bitfield.description: Writing "1" opens SBC for reading; automatically cleared on open completion
Writing "1" resets SBC; for debug only
Writing "1" resets the bit counters in SBC; resets SBC_TOTAL_COUNT to 0; also resets internal counters; cleared in the next cycle.
Writing "1" closes SBC; automatically cleared on close completion

register.description: BE Bin stream 2 SBC Status

bitfield.description: If 1, indicates that an underflowerror is seen; cleared on open completion.
If 1, indicates that codec i/f of SBC is stalled (not ready), due to lack of data in the internal registers of the SBC; valid after open; cleared on codec i/f becoming unstalled.
If 1, indicates that SBC is active - can be in read/write or halted state; valid after open; cleared on close
If 1, indicates that the SL2 i/f of SBC is halted, due to lack of bitstream data in the SL2; valid after open; cleared when SL2 i/f is unhalted

register.description: DRM Control for bitstream

bitfield.description: Reset the status bits in DDR_BITSTRM_SHADOW_STATUS and SL2_BITSTRM_SHADOW_STATUS. Cleared in the next cycle.

Debug only. Terminate DMA transfers; if set, then the following actions take place - All in-flight DMA is completed - If DMA direction is from DDR to SL2, all pending DMA requests are discarded - Status bits in DDR_BITSTRM_SHADOW_STATUS register are reset
Initializes the bitstream DRM FSM. This bit can be set to start the bit stream DMA through SW programming only, without involving the ECD5 controller logic.
SW trigger; used to indicate consumption on 1 page in the buffer. Setting this bit will trigger a VDMA request.

register.description: DDR bitstream base address

bitfield.description: Base address of bit stream buffer in DDR

register.description: DDR bitstream incremental valid pages

bitfield.description: Flag indicating whether the first page in the current DDR data descriptor is a partial page, i.e. it is not of the full page size. The size of the partial page is specified in DDR_BITSTRM_PARTIAL_PAGE_SIZE.FIRST_PAGE_SIZE. Data transferred to/from the SL2 will be aligned to the bottom of the SL2 page, i.e. DDR_BITSTRM_PARTIAL_PAGE_SIZE.FIRST_PAGE_SIZE amount of data will be transferred to/from the bottom of the current SL2 page. Note : This field is ignored if NUM_PAGES == 1 and PARTIAL_LAST_PAGE == 1.

Flag indicating whether the last page in the current DDR data descriptor is the last in the DDR, i.e. no more data available in DDR after the last page in the current DDR data descriptor. The DRM's VDMA i/f will terminate after the transfer of the last page in the current descriptor, if this flag is set. Any descriptors already programmed after the current descriptor will remain unused.

Number of bitstream buffer pages that have been incrementally filled in DDR. Setting this field to 0 force terminates the DRM's VDMA i/f (forces DRM VDMA i/f FSM to IDLE state, clears the fields of DDR_BITSTRM_SHADOW_STATUS) after completion of all previous data transfers specified by any previous bit stream descriptor. If there are no data transfers pending, setting this field to 0 force terminates the DRM immediately. Additionally, setting this bit causes the DRM to signal the last page of the previous bitstream descriptor as last, to the SBC. Note : If PARTIAL_FIRST_PAGE == PARTIAL_LAST_PAGE == 1, then NUM_PAGES has to be greater than 2.

Flag indicating whether the last page in the current DDR data descriptor is a partial page, i.e. it is not of the full page size. The size of the partial page is specified in DDR_BITSTRM_PARTIAL_PAGE_SIZE.LAST_PAGE_SIZE. Data transferred to/from the SL2 will be aligned to the top of the SL2 page, i.e. DDR_BITSTRM_PARTIAL_PAGE_SIZE.LAST_PAGE_SIZE amount of data will be transferred to/from the top of the current SL2 page.

register.description: DDR bitstream incremental valid pages

bitfield.description: Indicates the size in bytes of the data in the last page. This field is valid only if the DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES.PARTIAL_LAST_PAGE == 1
Indicates the size in bytes of the data in the last page. This field is valid only if the DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES.PARTIAL_FIRST_PAGE == 1

register.description: DDR bitstream shadow status register

bitfield.description: Indicates if DDR_BITSTRM_BASE_ADDR contents have been updated 1 : DDR_BITSTRM_BASE_ADDR has been updated and contents have not yet been copied into the shadow register 0 : DDR_BITSTRM_BASE_ADDR has not been updated, or contents have already been copied into the shadow register; DDR_BITSTRM_BASE_ADDR can be written again

Indicates if DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES contents have been updated 1 : DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES has been updated and contents have not yet been copied into the shadow register 0 : DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES has not been updated, or contents have already been copied into the shadow register; DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES can be written again

register.description: DDR bitstream base address shadow

bitfield.description: Shadow base address of bit stream buffer in DDR

register.description: DDR bitstream incremental valid pages shadow

bitfield.description: Shadow of flag indicating whether the first page in the current DDR data descriptor is a partial page, i.e. it is not of the full page size. Note : This field is ignored if NUM_PAGES == 1 and PARTIAL_LAST_PAGE == 1.
Shadow of flag indicating whether the last page in the current DDR data descriptor is the last in the DDR, i.e. no more data available in DDR after the last page in the current DDR data descriptor.

Shadow of the number of bitstream buffer pages that have been incrementally filled in DDR. This is also a working register field and gets decremented after completion of DMA transfer of each page between DDR and SL2
Shadow of flag indicating whether the last page in the current DDR data descriptor is a partial page, i.e. it is not of the full page size.

register.description: DDR bitstream incremental valid pages shadow

bitfield.description: Shadow of the size in bytes of the data in the last page. This field is valid only if the DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES_SHADOW.PARTIAL_LAST_PAGE == 1
Shadow of the size in bytes of the data in the last page. This field is valid only if the DDR_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES_SHADOW.PARTIAL_FIRST_PAGE == 1

register.description: SL2 bitstream incremental valid pages This register is used only in the fragmented mode

bitfield.description: Indicates the size in bytes of the data in the last page. This field is valid only if LAST_PAGE_IS_FINAL == 1
Flag indicating whether the last page in the current SL2 data descriptor is the last available i.e. no more data available in SL2 after the last page in the current SL2 data descriptor
Number of bitstream buffer pages that have been incrementally filled in SL2 (in decode), or is available to be filled by the core (in encode)

register.description: SL2 bitstream shadow status register This register is used only in the fragmented mode

bitfield.description: Indicates if SL2_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES contents have been updated 1 : SL2_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES has been updated and contents have not yet been copied into the shadow register 0 : SL2_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES has not been updated, or contents have already been copied into the shadow register; SL2_BITSTRM_INC_VALID_PAGES can be written again

register.description: SL2 bitstream incremental valid pages shadow This register is used only in the fragmented mode

bitfield.description: Shadow of the size in bytes of the data in the last page. This field is valid only if LAST_PAGE_IS_FINAL == 1
Shadow of flag indicating whether the last page in the current SL2 data descriptor is the last available, i.e. no more data available in SL2 after the last page in the current SL2 data descriptor

Shadow number of bitstream buffer pages that have been filled in SL2 (in decode), or available to be filled by the core (in encode); this field gets decremented after ECD5 (SBC) completes processing one page of bit-stream data

register.description: SBC Control

bitfield.description: Writing "1" opens SBC for reading; automatically cleared on open completion
Writing "1" resets SBC; for debug only
Writing "1" opens SBC for writing; automatically cleared on open completion
Writing "1" resets the bit counters in SBC; resets SBC_TOTAL_COUNT to 0; also resets internal counters; cleared in the next cycle.
Writing "1" closes SBC; automatically cleared on close completion

register.description: SBC Status

bitfield.description: If 1, indicates that an underflow (decode) or overflow (encode) error is seen; cleared on open completion.
If 1, in decode, indicates that end of slice overrun happened; cleared on open completion.
If 1, indicates that codec i/f of SBC is stalled (not ready), due to lack of data in the internal registers of the SBC; valid after open; cleared on codec i/f becoming unstalled.
If 1, indicates that SBC is active - can be in read/write or halted state; valid after open; cleared on close
If 1, indicates that startcode search is active; cleared automatically on startcode search completion.
If 1, indicates that the SL2 i/f of SBC is halted, due to lack of bitstream data in the SL2; valid after open; cleared when SL2 i/f is unhalted
If 1, in decode, indicates that an early EOS was detected; cleared on open completion.

register.description: SL2 bit pointer for SBC
Number of bits read/written by the SBC - i.e. decoded/encoded by the codec

bitfield.description:
a. In decode, used to keep track of slice level bits decoded b. Additionally, in decode, if SBC_NALU_CFG.SIZE_CHK_EN==1, used to compare against the NALU size to detect bitstream underflow and early EOS c. In encode, used to keep track of slice level bits encoded d. Additionally, in H.241 encode, used to compare against the NALU_CFG.SIZE register to identify slice threshold exceeded condition, and thereby trigger rewind
This counter is also incremented during start code searching. This bit count includes EPB. This register will have to be programmed before ECD is triggered for unit processing, to account for the bits decoded/encoded by iCont during header processing

register.description: Total size of NALU in bytes
SL2 bit pointer shadow for SBC
SBC Bit Programmation Control Register

bitfield.description: If STATUS == 0 when TRIGGER goes to 0, i.e. error was encountered during the specified operation, this field gives details on the error 0x0 : No error 0x1 : SBC not activated yet ( i.e. not opened) 0x2 : If OP == 0 or 1 or 4, SBC not ready; this happens when there is not sufficient bits (in case of decode) or space (in case of encode) to service the specified put_bits or jump_bits request If OP == 2, startcode was not found in the available data, 0x3 : If OP == 2, invalid operation due to startcode search triggered while the SBC was in write mode If OP == 4, invalid operation due to insertion of rbsp_trailing_bits triggered while the SBC was in read mode

Specified the bit manipulation operation to be performed 0x0 : Put bits; write specified (number and value) bits into SL2; increments bit pointer 0x1 : Jump bits; skip over specified number of bits in the SL2; increments the bit pointer 0x2 : Startcode search : do startcode search 0x3 : Get_num_bits_left_in_byte : get the number of bits needed to align the bit pointer to the beginning of the next byte 0x4 : Insert rbsp_trailing_bits; increments bit pointer

Indicates the completion status of the specified operation. This field is valid only when "TRIGGER" is 0. This field is cleared on setting TRIGGER to 1. A "1" in this field when TRIGGER goes to 0, indicates successful completion of the specified operation

Specifies the parametes for the requested bit processing operation. The meaning of this field depends on the operation requested. The mapping of the operation (OP field) to the meaning of this field is as follows: 0x0 (put bits) : number of bits to be put 0x1 (jump bits) : number of bits to be jumped over; the next 32 bits are then provided in SBC_BIT_PROG_DATA Valid values of this field are 0 to 31

Writing to this bit triggers the bit processing operation of the SBC. The operation performed depends on the "OP" field. This bit remains set until the specified operation completes, successfully or unsuccessfully

register.description: SBC Bit Programmation Data Register

bitfield.description: If SBC_BIT_PROG_CTRL.OP == 0 (put bits), this register holds the data that needs to be written to SL2 through SBC If SBC_BIT_PROG_CTRL.OP == 1 (jump bits), this register holds the next 32 bit data read from SL2 through SBC, after jumping by the specified length If SBC_BIT_PROG_CTRL.OP == 3 (get bits left in byte), this register holds the number of bits left in the current byte, to align to the next byte boundary

register.description: DRM Control for bitstream

bitfield.description: Reset the status bits in DDR_BITSTRM_SHADOW_STATUS and SL2_BITSTRM_SHADOW_STATUS; Cleared in the next cycle

Debug only. Terminate DMA transfers; if set, then the following actions take place - All in-flight DMA is completed - If DMA direction is from SL2 to DDR, all pending DMA requests are completed - If DMA direction is from DDR to SL2, all pending DMA requests are discarded. - Status bits in DDR_BITSTRM_SHADOW_STATUS register are reset
Initializes the bitstream DRM FSM. This bit can be set to start the bit stream DMA through SW programming only, without involving the ECD5 controller logic.

If there are no data transfers pending, setting this field to 0 force terminates the DRM immediately. Additionally, setting this bit causes the DRM to signal the last page of the previous bitstream descriptor as last, to the SBC. bitfield.description: If SBC_BIT_PROG_CTRL.OP == 0 (put bits), this register holds the data that needs to be written to SL2 through SBC If SBC_BIT_PROG_CTRL.OP == 1 (jump bits), this register holds the next 32 bit data read from SL2 through SBC, after jumping by the specified length If SBC_BIT_PROG_CTRL.OP == 3 (get bits left in byte), this register holds the number of bits left in the current byte, to align to the next byte boundary

bitfield.description: If '1', specifies "Direct Multi-page SL2 population" mode of operation

If '1', specifies SW interactive mode of operation. In this mode, the ECD5 does not interact directly with VDMA for bitstream DMA. Instead it triggers an interrupt for requesting DMA transfer of bitstream.
Number of pages in SL2
If '1', disables the triggering of VDMA. Only the SL2 buffer management is activated.
Size of each page in SL2 (in bytes); bits[3:0] are ignored, so the effective size is a multiple of 16 bytes

register.description: Buffer Parameters and configuration for bin stream 0 Note : Valid only in frame decoupled mode

bitfield.description: If '1', disables the triggering of VDMA. Only the SL2 buffer management is activated.

Size of each page in SL2 (in bytes); bits[3:0] are ignored, so the effective size is a multiple of 16 bytes Although the VDMA transfer for bin stream is deterministic, PAGE_SIZE is needed by ECD5 to know when to trigger VDMA - i.e. when the page becomes full. Since the size of each entry/write in the bin buffer is not fixed, the DMA is triggered when the total size of the wriiten data reaches PAGE_SIZE
Number of pages in SL2

Specifies if bit-stream DMA needs to be initialized at the start of pipe (frame/sub-frame) 0 - Disable 1 - Enable

register.description: FE Slice Data Processing Configuration register

bitfield.description: Specifies if bit-stream DMA need to be init at beginning of slice data processing 0 - Do not trigger initial bit stream DMA at the beginning of slice 1 - Trigger bitstream DMA at beginning of every slice
Enable/Disable flush of current bitstream descriptor at end of slice 0 - Disable 1 - Enable

Specifies the SBC control mode 0 - Initialize and Flush SBC at beginning and end of slice respectively 1 - Initialize and Flush SBC at beginning and end of every MB respectively Note : If SDP_EOS_SCS_EN == 1, then this bit will take effect for SBC close after the startcode search after EOS.
Specifies if MB mode is enabled for slice data decode 0 - No control at MB level 1 - MB processing engine has to be specifically enabled at every MB
Enable/Disable flush of current bitstream descriptor at start of slice 0 - Disable 1 - Enable
Enable/Disable automatic startcode search on detecting end of slice 0 - Disable 1 - Enable
Specifies if bit-stream DMA needs to be terminated at the end of slice 0 - Do not terminate bit stream DMA at the end of slice 1 - Terminate bitstream DMA at end of slice

register.description: CABAC Configuration register for enabling error for potentially incorrect behavior

bitfield.description: If this value is 1 and cabac_alignment_one_bit is not "1", error is flagged immediately.

If this value is 1 and EOS mismatch is detected, error is flagged immediately. EOS mismatch is detected when a. EOS flag in MB is "1", but there is more data in the bit-stream b. EOS flag in MB is "0", but there is no more data in the bit-stream
If this value is 1 and Temporal B Direct MB is detected, error is flagged immediately.
If this value is 1 and EOS is not detected while decoding the last MB in the frame, error is flagged immediately.
If this value is 1 and pcm_alignment_zero_bit is not "0", error is flagged immediately.
If this value is 1 and ref_idx_lx ( x == 0 or 1 ) is out of the range [0,CABAC_REF_IDX_MAX_Lx.VALUE], error is flagged immediately .

register.description: CABAC Configuration register for enabling interrupt for potentially incorrect behavior If a bit is set in this register and corresponding bit is not set in the CABAC_CFG_ERROR_EN register, then, on hitting the corresponding condition in an MB, INT_ERR1 is triggered on the completion of the MB. CABAC_DEC_ERR status bit is set in the interrupt status registers corresponding to INT_ERR1.

bitfield.description: If this value is 1 and cabac_alignment_one_bit is not "1", interrupt is (conditionally) generated on completion of MB.

If this value is 1 and EOS mismatch is detected, interrupt is (conditionally) generated on completion of MB EOS mismatch is detected when a. EOS flag in MB is "1", but there is more data in the bit-stream b. EOS flag in MB is "0", but there is no more data in the bit-stream
If this value is 1 and Temporal B Direct MB is detected, interrupt is (conditionally) generated on completion of MB.
If this value is 1 and EOS is not detected while decoding the last MB in the frame, interrupt is (conditionally) generated on completion of MB.
If this value is 1 and pcm_alignment_zero_bit is not "0", interrupt is (conditionally) generated on completion of MB.
If this value is 1 and ref_idx_lx (x == 0 or 1 ) is out of the range [0,CABAC_REF_IDX_MAX_Lx.VALUE], interrupt is (conditionally) generated on completion of MB.

register.description: Status of DRM channel controller for bit stream buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates availability of at least one valid page in SL2 for processing by the ECD core
Indicates state of the bitstream control DRM FSM
If "1", indicates that the DRM channel for bitstream control is IDLE. Used to check for completion of DMA after a terminate request.

register.description: Buffer Status for bitstream buffer Reflects the current internal and DMA status of bit stream buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the number of pages currently valid in SL2. In the case of read ( data transferred from DDR to SL2 , and read by the ECD core ), this field indicates the number of pages available for the ECD to read from SL2. This count is initialized to 0 on DRM initialization. This count is incremented on completion of each page of DMA. The count is decremented whenever one page of data is consumed by the ECD core. In the case of write ( data written by ECD core to SL2, and transferred from SL2 to DDR ), this field indicates the number of pages in SL2 available for the ECD core to write into. This count is initialized to the total number of pages (ECD5_BE_BUFFER_CONTROL.DRM_BUF_CFG_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES) on DRM initialization. The count is decremented every time ECD writes one page to SL2. The count is incremented whenever the DMA of one page from SL2 to DDR is completed.
Indicates the SL2 page number where the next data will be read from, by the ECD core (MBP); valid values are 0 to DRM_BUF_PARAMS_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES - 1; reset on DMA initialization

register.description: Buffer Status for bit stream buffer Reflects the current internal and DMA status of bit stream buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the SL2 address of the page where the next data will be read from, by the ECD core (MBP) ; reset on DMA initialization to SL2 base address of the buffer in SL2

register.description: Buffer DMA Status for bitstream buffer Reflects the current DMA status of bin stream 0 buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the SL2 page number to which the next page DMA will happen (written to) when enabling conditions for DMA are met (SL2 page is consumed by ECD5 core); valid values are 0 to DRM_BUF_PARAMS_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES - 1; reset on DMA initialization
Indicates the total number of pages for which DMA has completed; reset on DMA initialization

register.description: Current status

bitfield.description: Indicates whether the FE-MBP is busy 0 - Idle 1 - Busy

Indicates Error was detected during decode of last Macroblock. If set to 1, indicates that the last macroblock had error. On detecting error, ECD5 issues ERR interrupt (if enabled) and sets this flag. ERR flag is automatically cleared by ECD5 core if either one of the following condition is true: EN bit in SYSTEM_MMR.ECD5_FE_UNIT_ENABLE register is set to 1 EN bit in SYSTEM_MMR.ECD5_FE_ENABLE register is set to 1 * start of new macroblock processing * hwa_init request is received

Indicates End of Pipe (frame/sub-frame) was detected during decode of the last Macroblock. If set to 1, indicates that the last macroblock is at the end of the frame/sub-frame. On detecting EOP, ECD5 issues EOP interrupt (if enabled) and sets this flag. EOP flag is automatically cleared by ECD5 core if one of the following condition is true: EN bit in SYSTEM_MMR.ECD5_FE_ENABLE register is set to 1 * hwa_init request is received

Indicates End of Slice was detected during decode of the last Macroblock. If set to 1, indicates that the last macroblock is at the end of the slice. On detecting EOS, ECD5 issues EOS interrupt (if enabled) and sets this flag. EOS flag is automatically cleared by ECD5 core if either one of the following condition is true: EN bit in SYSTEM_MMR.ECD5_FE_UNIT_ENABLE register is set to 1 EN bit in SYSTEM_MMR.ECD5_FE_ENABLE register is set to 1 * hwa_init request is received

register.description: CABAC Error Status. This register reflects the status of any error detected during MB decode.

bitfield.description: This bit is set if level is out of range, this error is issued. Valid range of level is [-2^(7+bitDepth), 2^(7+bitDepth)-1].
This bit is set if Temporal B Direct MB is detected.
This bit is set if pcm_alignment_zero_bit that is not "0" is detected

This bit is set if decoded MVD is out of range. Valid range of MVD is different between horizontal and vertical (Horizontal and vertical MVD have different out of range detectors) Valid Horizontal MVD range is [-16383,16383] in quarter-pel. Valid Vertical MVD range is [-4095,4095] in quarter-pel.
This bit is set if decoded ref_idx_l0 or ref_idx_l1 is greater than 31.
This bit is set if cabac_alignment_one_bit that is not "1" is detected
This bit is set if decoded mb_qp_delta is out of range. Valid range of mb_qp_delta is as follows: [-26,25] when bitDepth == 8, [-20,31] when bitDepth == 10, [-14,37] when bitDepth == 12.
This bit is set if ref_idx_lx ( x == 0 or 1 ) out of the range [0,ECD5_FE_FUNC.CABAC_REF_IDX_MAX_LX.VALUE] is detected

register.description: Buffer Control Parameters for sliceInfo Note : 1. In decode, in CABAC N MB decoupled mode, this register defines the parameters for the sliceInfo SL2BC between FE and BE (input to BE from FE) 2. In decode, in frame decoupled mode and CAVLC mode, this register defines the parameters for the sliceInfo SL2BC between the BE and the ROP (output from BE to ROP) 3. In encode, this register defines the parameters for the sliceInfo SL2BC between ROP and BE (input to BE from ROP)

BC Virtual Depth

register.description: Buffer Control Start Pointers for sliceInfo Note : 1. In decode, in frame decoupled mode and CAVLC mode, this register defines the write start pointer for the sliceInfo SL2BC between the BE and the ROP (output from BE to ROP) 3. In encode, this register defines the read and write start pointers for the sliceInfo SL2BC between ROP and BE (input to BE from ROP)

register.description: Buffer parameters and configuration for bit stream Note : Unused in non-frame-decoupled configuration; the corresponding registers in FE_BUFFER_CONTROL are used.

bitfield.description: If '1', specifies "Direct Multi-page SL2 population" mode of operation

If '1', specifies SW interactive mode of operation. In this mode, the ECD5 does not interact directly with VDMA for bitstream DMA. Instead it triggers an interrupt for requesting DMA transfer of bitstream.
Number of pages in SL2
If '1', disables the triggering of VDMA. Only the SL2 buffer management is activated.
Size of each page in SL2 (in bytes); bits[3:0] are ignored, so the effective size is a multiple of 16 bytes

register.description: DMA Group ID for bit stream Note : Unused in non-frame-decoupled configuration; the corresponding registers in FE_BUFFER_CONTROL are used.

bitfield.description: Group ID for VDMA transfer

register.description: Buffer parameters and configuration for sliceInfo and sliceRPL Note : Used only in frame decoupled mode

bitfield.description: Number of data structure entries in each page of sliceInfo, sliceExpWeightTable and sliceRPL data. Note : This field (together w/ the size of each entry, i.e. for eg. sliceInfo size (2 words)) should be consistent with the PAGE_SIZE field, i.e. NUM_PAGE_ENTRIES * sizeof(sliceInfo) = DRM_BUF_CFG_SLICEINFO.PAGE_SIZE
If '1', disables the triggering of VDMA. Only the SL2 buffer management is activated.

Size of each page of sliceInfo in SL2 (in bytes); bits[3:0] are ignored, so the effective size is a multiple of 16 bytes This should be consistent w/ the value of DRM_BUF_CFG_SLICEINFO.NUM_ENTRIES_PER_PAGE, such that this number of sliceInfo entries should fit within the page size.
Number of pages of sliceInfo in SL2

register.description: DMA Group ID for sliceInfo and sliceRPL Note : Used only in frame decoupled mode

bitfield.description: Group ID for VDMA transfer

register.description: Max bytes DMA transfer limit for sliceRPL Note : Used only in frame decoupled mode

bitfield.description: Total maximum number of bytes that will be transferred by ECD through VDMA. The actual limit for transfer is "ceil( SIZE / DRM_BUF_CFG_SLICEINFO.PAGE_SIZE ) * PAGE_SIZE", i.e. the closest upper integral number of pages. This value will be decremented by HW when DRM is operational and should not be overwritten except when DRM is in IDLE.
If '1', enables limiting the DMA transfer for bin stream 0 to "SIZE"

register.description: Codec Type

bitfield.description: Specifies whether current layer is base or enhancement layer; valid only id CODEC_TYPE == 1 (SVC) 0 - Base Layer 1 - Enhancement Layer

register.description: BE Mode

bitfield.description:
Specifies if encode or decode for BE 0 - Decode 1 - Encode
Note : If DIR == 1 and ENTROPY_CODING_MODE == 1, note that FE0 shall not be enabled (since CABAC engine 0 will be used in encode mode)
Specifies if Encoder is in H.241 mode 0 - H.241 Mode disabled 1 - H.241 Mode enabled

register.description: Frame Level Config for CABAC in decode
CABAC Basic (Level 0) Config for decode
CABAC Slice Data Decode Configuration register

bitfield.description: Specifies the bin SBC control mode 0 - Initialize and Flush SBC at beginning and end of pipe respectively 1 - Initialize and Flush SBC at beginning and end of every MB respectively
Specifies if MB mode is enabled for slice data decode 0 - No control at MB level 1 - MB processing engine has to be specifically enabled at every MB

register.description: Frame Level Config for CAVLC in decode

bitfield.description: Specifies if bit-stream DMA needs to be terminated at the end of pipe 0 - Do not terminate bit stream DMA at the end of pipe 1 - Terminate bitstream DMA at end of pipe
Specifies if bit-stream DMA needs to be initialized at the start of pipe (frame/sub-frame) 0 - Disable 1 - Enable

register.description: CAVLC Basic (Level 0) Config for decode
CAVLC Decode Slice Data Processing Configuration

bitfield.description: Specifies if bit-stream DMA need to be init at beginning of slice data processing 0 - Do not trigger initial bit stream DMA at the beginning of slice 1 - Trigger bitstream DMA at beginning of every slice
Enable/Disable flush of current bitstream descriptor at end of slice 0 - Disable 1 - Enable

Specifies the SBC control mode 0 - Initialize and Flush SBC at beginning and end of slice respectively 1 - Initialize and Flush SBC at beginning and end of every MB respectively Note : If SDP_EOS_SCS_EN == 1, then this bit will take effect for SBC close after the startcode search after EOS.
Specifies if MB mode is enabled for slice data decode 0 - No control at MB level 1 - MB processing engine has to be specifically enabled at every MB
Enable/Disable flush of current bitstream descriptor at start of slice 0 - Disable 1 - Enable
Enable/Disable automatic startcode search on detecting end of slice 0 - Disable 1 - Enable
Specifies if bit-stream DMA needs to be terminated at the end of slice 0 - Do not terminate bit stream DMA at the end of slice 1 - Terminate bitstream DMA at end of slice

register.description: Encoder Frame Level Initialization Configuration

bitfield.description: Specifies if bit-stream DMA needs to be terminated at the end of pipe 0 - Do not terminate bit stream DMA at the end of pipe 1 - Terminate bitstream DMA at end of pipe Setting this bit results in flushing any un-transferred bit-stream data in the SL2 to DDR at the end of pipe, and discarding of bit-stream descriptors.
Specifies if bit-stream DMA needs to be initialized at the start of pipe (frame/sub-frame) 0 - Disable 1 - Enable

register.description: Encoder Basic (Level 0) Configuration
Encoder Slice Processing Configuration

bitfield.description: Specifies if bit-stream DMA need to be init at beginning of slice data processing 0 - Do not initialize bit stream DMA at the beginning of slice 1 - Initialize bitstream DMA at beginning of every slice
Enable/Disable flush of current bitstream descriptor at end of slice 0 - Disable 1 - Enable
Specifies the SBC control mode 0 - Initialize and Flush SBC at beginning and end of slice respectively 1 - Initialize and Flush SBC at beginning and end of every MB respectively
Specifies if MB mode is enabled for slice data decode 0 - No control at MB level 1 - MB processing engine has to be specifically enabled at every MB
Enable/Disable flush of current bitstream descriptor at start of slice 0 - Disable 1 - Enable

Specifies if bit-stream DMA needs to be terminated at the end of slice 0 - Do not terminate bit stream DMA at the end of slice 1 - Terminate bitstream DMA at end of slice Setting this bit results in flushing any un-transferred bit-stream data in the SL2 to DDR at the end of slice, and discarding of the bit-stream descriptors

register.description: CAVLC Configuration register for enabling error for potentially incorrect behavior

bitfield.description: Reserved for slice data processing control
If this value is 1 and Temporal B Direct MB is detected, error is flagged immediately.
If this value is 1 and level becomes out of range [-2^(7+bitDepth), 2^(7+bitDepth)-1] (due to error in level_suffix), error is flagged immediately.
If this value is 1 and EOS is not detected while decoding the last MB in the frame, error is flagged immediately.
If this value is 1 and pcm_alignment_zero_bit is not "0", error is flagged immediately.
If this value is 1 and ref_idx_lx ( x == 0 or 1 ) is out of the range [0,DEC_CAVLC_REF_IDX_MAX_Lx.VALUE], error is flagged immediately .

register.description: CAVLC Configuration register for enabling interrupt for potential incorrect behavior If a bit is set in this register and corresponding bit is not set in the DEC_CAVLC_CFG_ERROR_EN register, then, on hitting the corresponding condition in an MB, INT_ERR0 is triggered on the completion of the MB. CAVLC_DEC_ERR status bit is set in the interrupt status registers corresponding to INT_ERR0.

bitfield.description: If this value is 1 and Temporal B Direct MB is detected, interrupt is (conditionally) generated on completion of MB.
If this value is 1 and level becomes out of range [-2^(7+bitDepth), 2^(7+bitDepth)-1] (due to error in level_suffix), interrupt is (conditionally) generated on completion of MB.
If this value is 1 and EOS is not detected while decoding the last MB in the frame, interrupt is (conditionally) generated on completion of MB.
If this value is 1 and pcm_alignment_zero_bit is not "0", interrupt is (conditionally) generated on completion of MB.
If this value is 1 and ref_idx_lx ( x == 0 or 1 ) is out of the range [0,DEC_CAVLC_REF_IDX_MAX_Lx.VALUE], interrupt is (conditionally) generated on completion of MB.

register.description: CAVLC Max refidx for L0

bitfield.description: Specifies the max refidx value for L0 for error checking

register.description: CAVLC Max refidx for L1

bitfield.description: Specifies the max refidx value for L1 for error checking

register.description: Start offset for MVInfo top buffer in DDR. Valid only in decode.
Start offset for MVInfo bottom buffer in DDR. Valid only in decode.

Buffer status for sliceInfo buffer (read/written) by BE Note : 1. Decode - CAVLC mode : this register reflects the status of the sliceInfo buffer between the BE and the ROP (output from BE to ROP). Although the SL2 buffer is not populated by the BE, the BE communicates the availability of data in the buffer to the ROP through SL2BC 2. Decode - CABAC N MB decoupled mode : this register reflects the status for the sliceInfo SL2BC between FE and BE (input to BE from FE) 3. Decode - CABAC frame decoupled mode : this register reflects the status of the sliceInfo buffer between the BE and the ROP (output from BE to ROP) 3. Encode : this register reflects the status for the sliceInfo SL2BC between ROP and BE (input to BE from ROP)

bitfield.description: Current Read Pointer Valid only in encode and non-frame decoupled CABAC decode
Buffer Empty Status 0 : Buffer Not Empty 1 : Buffer Empty Valid only in encode and non-frame decoupled CABAC decode

Buffer Full Status 0 : Buffer Not Full 1 : Buffer Full Valid only in encode and non-frame decoupled CABAC decode
Indicates the BC status on the write side BC NOT READY = 00 (wr_core_busy=0 AND wr_bc_ready=0) BC READY = 01 (wr_core_busy=0 AND wr_bc_ready=1) BC BUSY = 1x (wr_core_busy=1)
Current Write Pointer

register.description: Status of DRM channel controller for bit stream buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates availability of at least one valid page in SL2 for processing by the ECD core
Indicates state of the bitstream control DRM FSM
If "1", indicates that the DRM channel for bitstream control is IDLE. Used to check for completion of DMA after a terminate request.

register.description: Buffer Status for bitstream buffer Valid only in frame decoupled mode Reflects the current internal and DMA status of bit stream buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the number of pages currently valid in SL2. In the case of read ( data transferred from DDR to SL2 , and read by the ECD core ), this field indicates the number of pages available for the ECD to read from SL2. This count is initialized to 0 on DRM initialization. This count is incremented on completion of each page of DMA. The count is decremented whenever one page of data is consumed by the ECD core. In the case of write ( data written by ECD core to SL2, and transferred from SL2 to DDR ), this field indicates the number of pages in SL2 available for the ECD core to write into. This count is initialized to the total number of pages (ECD5_BE_BUFFER_CONTROL.DRM_BUF_CFG_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES) on DRM initialization. The count is decremented every time ECD writes one page to SL2. The count is incremented whenever the DMA of one page from SL2 to DDR is completed.

Indicates the SL2 page number where the next data will be read from, by the ECD core (MBP) in decode, or written to , in encode; valid values are 0 to DRM_BUF_PARAMS_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES - 1; reset on DMA initialization

register.description: Buffer Status for bit stream buffer Valid only in frame decoupled mode. Reflects the current internal and DMA status of bit stream buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the SL2 address of the page where the next data will be read from (in decode), or written to (in encode) , by the ECD core (MBP) ; reset on DMA initialization to SL2 base address of the buffer in SL2

register.description: Buffer DMA Status for bitstream buffer Valid only in frame decoupled mode. Reflects the current DMA status of bin stream 0 buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the SL2 page number to which the next page DMA will happen (written to) in decode, or from which the next page DMA will happen (read from) in encode, when enabling conditions for DMA are met (SL2 page is consumed by ECD5 core in decode; SL2 page is filled by ECD5 core in encode); valid values are 0 to DRM_BUF_PARAMS_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES - 1; reset on DMA initialization
Indicates the total number of pages for which DMA has completed; reset on DMA initialization

Indicates state of the channel control DRM FSM
If "1", indicates that the DRM channel control FSM is IDLE. Used to check for completion of DMA after a terminate request.

register.description: Buffer Status for sliceInfo buffer Valid only in frame decoupled mode. Reflects the current internal and DMA status of the buffer

Indicates the SL2 page number where the next data will be read from by the ECD core (MBP); valid values are 0 to DRM_BUF_PARAMS_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES - 1; reset on DMA initialization
For debug only. Indicates the index of the entry that is currently being read or will be read next by the ECD5 core in the current page; reset on DMA initialization

register.description: Buffer Status for sliceInfo buffer Valid only in frame decoupled mode. Reflects the current internal and DMA status of the buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the SL2 address of the page where the next data will be read from by the ECD core (MBP) ; reset on DMA initialization to SL2 base address of the buffer in SL2

register.description: Buffer Status for current bottom MBHdrInfo buffer Valid only in frame decoupled mode. Reflects the current internal and DMA status of the buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the number of pages currently valid in SL2. This field indicates the number of pages in SL2 available for the ECD core to write into. This count is initialized to the total number of pages (ECD5_BE_BUFFER_CONTROL.DRM_BUF_CFG_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES) on DRM initialization. The count is decremented every time ECD writes one page to SL2. The count is incremented whenever the DMA of one page from SL2 to DDR is completed.
Indicates the SL2 page number where the next data will be written to by the ECD core (MBP); valid values are 0 to DRM_BUF_PARAMS_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES - 1; reset on DMA initialization
For debug only. Indicates the index of the entry that is currently being written or will be written next by the ECD5 core in the current page; reset on DMA initialization

register.description: Buffer Status for current bottom MBHdrInfo buffer Valid only in frame decoupled mode. Reflects the current internal and DMA status of the buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the SL2 address of the page where the next data will be written to by the ECD core (MBP) ; reset on DMA initialization to SL2 base address of the buffer in SL2

register.description: Buffer DMA Status for current bottom MBHdrInfo buffer Valid only in frame decoupled mode. Reflects the current DMA status of bin stream 3 buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the SL2 page number from which the next page DMA will happen (read from) when enabling conditions for DMA are met (SL2 page is filled by ECD5 core); valid values are 0 to DRM_BUF_PARAMS_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES - 1; reset on DMA initialization
Indicates the total number of pages for which DMA has completed; reset on DMA initialization

register.description: Status of DRM channel controller forcurrent bottom MBMVInfo buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates availability of at least one valid page in SL2 for processing by the ECD core
Indicates state of the channel control DRM FSM
If "1", indicates that the DRM channel control FSM is IDLE. Used to check for completion of DMA after a terminate request.

register.description: Buffer Status for current bottom MBMVInfo buffer Valid only in frame decoupled mode. Reflects the current internal and DMA status of the buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the number of pages currently valid in SL2. This field indicates the number of pages in SL2 available for the ECD core to write into. This count is initialized to the total number of pages (ECD5_BE_BUFFER_CONTROL.DRM_BUF_CFG_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES) on DRM initialization. The count is decremented every time ECD writes one page to SL2. The count is incremented whenever the DMA of one page from SL2 to DDR is completed.
Indicates the SL2 page number where the next data will be written to by the ECD core (MBP); valid values are 0 to DRM_BUF_PARAMS_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES - 1; reset on DMA initialization

register.description: Buffer Status for current bottom MBMVInfo buffer Valid only in frame decoupled mode. Reflects the current internal and DMA status of the buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the SL2 address of the page where the next data will be written to by the ECD core (MBP) ; reset on DMA initialization to SL2 base address of the buffer in SL2

register.description: Buffer DMA Status for current bottom MBMVInfo buffer Valid only in frame decoupled mode. Reflects the current DMA status of bin stream 3 buffer

bitfield.description: Indicates the SL2 page number from which the next page DMA will happen (read from) when enabling conditions for DMA are met (SL2 page is filled by ECD5 core); valid values are 0 to DRM_BUF_PARAMS_[BUFFER_NAME].NUM_PAGES - 1; reset on DMA initialization
Indicates the total number of pages for which DMA has completed; reset on DMA initialization

register.description: BE Status

bitfield.description: Indicates whether the BE-MBP is busy 0 - Idle 1 - Busy

Indicates Error was detected during decode of last Macroblock. If set to 1, indicates that the last macroblock had error. When receiving ERR signal from codec engine, ECD5 issues ERR interrupt (if enabled) and sets this flag. ERR flag is automatically cleared if either one of the following condition is true: - EN bit in SYSTEM_MMR.ECD5_BE_UNIT_ENABLE register is set to 1. - EN bit in SYSTEM_MMR.ECD5_BE_ENABLE register is set to 1. - start of new macroblock processing - hwa_init request is received

Indicates End of Pipe (frame/sub-frame) was detected during decode of the last Macroblock. If set to 1, indicates that the last macroblock is at the end of the frame/sub-frame. On detecting EOP, ECD5 issues EOP interrupt (if enabled) and sets this flag. EOP flag is automatically cleared by ECD5 core if one of the following condition is true: - EN bit in SYSTEM_MMR.ECD5_BE_ENABLE register is set to 1 - hwa_init request is received

Indicates End of Slice was detected during decode of the last Macroblock. If set to 1, indicates that the last macroblock is at the end of the slice. When receiving EOS signal from codec engine, ECD5 issues EOS interrupt (if enabled) and sets this flag. EOS flag is automatically cleared if either one of the following condition is true: - EN bit in SYSTEM_MMR.ECD5_BE_UNIT_ENABLE register is set to 1. - EN bit in SYSTEM_MMR.ECD5_BE_ENABLE register is set to 1 - hwa_init request is received

register.description: Error MB address This register provides the address of the MB in which error was detected by BE core or by CAVLC

bitfield.description: Specifies the Y position of the error MB
Specifies the X position of the error MB

register.description: Static MB count

bitfield.description: Count of H.241 static MBs (section 8.3.2.8 of H.241 standard)

register.description: BE Error Status

bitfield.description: This bit is set if (frame_id, bottomFieldFlag) is not found in RefPicList.

register.description: CAVLC Error Status

bitfield.description: This bit is set if total zeros in bitstream is out of table or num_coeff + total_zeros > max_coeff_num.

This bit is set if decoded MVD is out of range. The range of MVD is different between horizontal and vertical (Horizontal and vertical MVD have different out of range detectors) Valid Horizontal MVD range is [-16383,16383] in quarter-pel. Valid Vertical MVD range is [-4095,4095] in quarter-pel.
This bit is set if decoded mb_type_id is out of range. The range of mb_type_id is mb_type < 26 in I_SLICE, mb_type < 31 in P_SLICE, mb_type < 49 in B_SLICE
This bit is set if level becomes out of range [-2^(7+bitDepth), 2^(7+bitDepth)-1] (due to error in level_suffix).
This bit is set if decoded intra_chroma_pred_mode is out of range. The range of intra_chroma_pred_mode is: intra_chroma_pred_mode < 4
This bit is set if decoded mb_qp_delta is out of range. The range of mb_qp_delta is defined as follows: [-26,25] when bitDepth == 8, [-20,31] when bitDepth == 10, [-14,37] when bitDepth == 12.
This bit is set if ref_idx_lx ( x == 0 or 1 ) out of the range [0,ECD5_BE_FUNC.CAVLC_REF_IDX_MAX_LX.VALUE] is detected
This bit is set if Temporal B Direct MB is detected.
This bit is set if pcm_alignment_zero_bit that is not "0" is detected

This bit is set if coef_token in bitstream is out of table or numcoef > max_coeff_num. * Caution: 8<=nC table is 6bit fixed length, but has error in the case 0b000010 and 0b000111. * Max_coeff_num is the number of maximum coefficients derived from block size, 15 or 16. * numcoef is the value derived from coef_token table.
This bit is set if decoded sub_mb_type is out of range The range of sub_mb_type is: sub_mb_type_id < 4 in P_SLICE, sub_mb_type_id < 13 in B_SLICE.
This bit is set if decoded level_prefix is out of range. The range of level_prefix is [0, (11+bitDepth)].
This bit is set if decoded ref_idx_l0 or ref_idx_l1 is greater than 31.
This bit is set if run_before in bitstream is out of table.

register.description: Current status of CABAC Engine

bitfield.description: This bit equal to 1 indicates that the next bit put by CABAC is the first bit since the last CABAC initialization. This register is automatically set by CABAC encoder. This flag is ignored in decoding
Current Code Offset for CABAC encoding/decoding
Current Syntax Element
Current Code Range for CABAC encoding/decoding

register.description: CABAC Outstanding bits

bitfield.description: Total number of outstanding bits in CABAC encoder. This register is not used in decoding.This register is maintained by ECD5.The value of this register is undefined if an error interrupt (INT_ERRx) is issued

register.description: CABAC Bin count

bitfield.description: Total number of bins encoded/decoded. This register is reset to zero when H.264 core is invoked for a first macroblock in a slice or when CABAC decoder is invoked for an MB level execution. The value of this register is undefined if an error interrupt (int_err) is issued
